comment.text:
I had the most incredible brunch experience at Botica yesterday around 3pm! As someone who loves going out to eat, I appreciate a great experience. 

First off, the environment is very full of life, there is a huge round bar in the middle of the restaurant, a nice sunny patio area, and there's a pop of color everywhere you look! The music is fun and not too loud. There's a lot of Hispanic inspired decor and I love it! 

As far as food, my partner and I decided to try the chicken and waffles, steak and eggs and a mango mimosa. The mimosa was very delicious, it is such a good reliable drink. The steak and eggs were cooked to perfection, I ordered my steak medium and my eggs scrambled, the potatoes were also a hit. The chicken and waffles were good as well! I love the way it was set up on the plate with pineapple and nice organization. 

As far as service, our server Merma was very attentive. We went during brunch time so we were worried it would be a bit too busy, but she did amazing and made sure we had everything we needed. She was excellent I definitely recommend asking for her. Mina was also great and he checked on us as well with a friendly smile and conversation. The service alone was enough to convince us to want to come back soon! Great food, service and environment, it was all amazing!

Botica replaced Watershed (one of my old faves UGH) but I was still excited to see what Botica was all about. We made reservations at Botica for my bestie's birthday dinner and even though it was a Tuesday night, the parking deck was POPPING like I don't know why there were so many people out and about. We witnessed a fender bender in the super tight parking deck. Luckily we weren't a part of that mess and headed toward the restaurant entrance. Parking is validated once you park in the attached deck when you enter your license on the iPad at the hostess stand.

It's a big ole party when you arrive - even on a Tuesday night. Back in 2022, the crispy fish tacos were $2 each so of course we ordered one per person, along with tasty tapas and apps, including the patatas bravas, the wagu carpaccio, the Spanish grilled octopus and the tuna crudo. My absolute FAVORITE bite was the crispy Diablo wings - super spicy but tasted great. 

And you know it's not a birthday without green tea shots - only $10 a piece phew. Definitely recommend Botica to celebrate or even to grab just a casual bite to eat!

Went for happy hour as a first timer and this place is pretty good. They offer free 3hr parking, and a decent HH. For me, the eggplant empanadas were bomb. They only give you one cut in half but I had at least 2 or 3 of them. 

Jordan the bartender was A1 and made the best drinks that night. Nice and strong. All HH items are $5 but be careful, it can add up quickly. 

I wasn't impressed with their quesadillas, unfortunately. For starters, the beans are inside of the quesadilla, not on the side with the rice. BLASPHEMY! Also, as you can see in the picture, not much holding it together. I chose salmon for my protein and for what I paid, it was definitely underwhelming. 

Overall, staff was nice, HH was good and there's free 3 hr parking w/validation.

Meh. Came in at opening. No host at the front but he walked over shortly after and was friendly. Service was good. It indeed slow. I got the steak and egg brunch option and a pork belly taco. Both were good but neither were exceptional. So why the 3 stars? The prices. Steak and eggs plus the taco came out to $50, I get it steak is expensive but if it's going to be that expensive at least make it stand out from the rest.  I was seated in the back and service took a while to get to me but they have a lot of tvs to keep you entertained. The taco was decent enough to get again but at the prices I'd be hesitant to go back for the mediocrity. I will also say that the portion for the steak was pretty large but eggs and potato aren't expensive ‚Äç maybe they just need to work on the portion size to adjust pricing appropriately but yeah.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for taking the time to review your experience. Our prices reflect the quality of the food being served. We source from only the top providers to provide a delicious meal. We do offer specials throughout the week, like our $5 Happy Hour Menu ever Mon-Fri from 4-7pm.

comment.text: This is in my top 10 of restaurants and I've been coming here for at least 5 years now and I literally order the same things all the time, every time. Tuna Crudo is the first thing. It's is so yummy. Flash grilled Ahi Tuna w Fresh Jalepeno Slice on top, with a Truffle Oil Cr√®me and Served w Guacamole in the Center w Plantain Chips!!! So freakin good. I usually get some shots since they have a really extensive tequila menu and a Blood Orange Margarita. Then second fave is the Salmon entree, it's Salmon w chimichurri and spinach and grilled corn and arugula! Again this is a must for me every time. I usually get a asada taco on the side! lol yea I'm greedy. And I close w a creme br√ªl√©e topped w blackberries. This is a great girl date spot or just real date spot. I'll be back soon. They actually make 3 different types of house hot sauces so ask for some. 10/10 definitely recommend

owner_replies.comment: We love to hear it! Thank you so much for the glowing review!

comment.text: Came here to watch Michigan UPSET the Tide!!!! WOOOOO! Lol ok. That's out of my system. But I sat at the bar of course... the bartenders were nice and made some great drink suggestions. I had the nachos and just going to say... fine men gather here lol. The atmosphere was fun and bubbly and the game made it I'm even better. I will be back

Came here tonight to celebrate a coworker leaving and starting a new adventure. We had about 20-25 people which we had our own private area with the most amazing two servers. First time here but not my last now.

photos.caption: Taco! Carne Asada, Shrimp and Crispy Salmon. $5.75 each

owner_replies.comment: Thank you so much for the kind words! We hope to see you back again soon.

comment.text: After haven't brunch my friend and I stopped over Botica for drinks. We were seated right away and the bar was filled crowded with people watching college football so it was VERY LOUD. It didn't bother us though so it was fine and quite entertaining when the team won. Our waiter was attentive and I started off with a Mexican mule and that took me a little bit to finish. I believe my friend ordered the Botica and I don't think he enjoyed it as much. I asked if they knew how to make a French 75 and they did. I ordered that for my second drink and that absolutely did the job. It was pretty tasty and they surely filled that drink to the brim! It's average price for drinks so seems pretty normal, but I thought it was a cool chill spot. I would go back and see what the food is like as well.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you so much for the kind words! We hope to see you back again soon.

comment.text:
I've been to Botica one other time and the experience was mid but this time was a lot better! Ordered the salmon quesadilla as my entree and it's was actually very good! I feel like salmon is a hard clncept for restaurants to master cause it's either not seasoned enough or overly seasoned but this was a great balance. It was a bit oily like noticeably oily but if you give your diet a break for the day you can ignore it 

The Mexican rice and the black beans were very nice as well! Not your typical yellow rice but the rice was seasoned with a little bit of spiciness to it. I was a fan!

Highly suggest ordering the coconut mojito as a drink. Some other people at the table had the pineapple and said they weren't a fan but I loved the coconut mojito. The table had great remarks about aperol spritz froze as well!

Pricing was a bit pricier than expected for a Mexican restaurant -- 20% gratuity is added to all checks and there is a liquor tax so it does add up. My bill with just an entree and a drink was $47 so with appetizers and things like that it'll take up. Now is the food worth the price -- maybe if you really love Mexican food ‚Äç 

They do a great job of celebrating birthdays tho!

Mina, one of the Manager's is the best. Always so friendly and engaging. They recently added hour hour and it is mos def a reason to visit even more. For sports fans, there are TV's everywhere you look. Give this place a try, you will not be disappointed.

PACKEDDDDDD on Cinco De Mayo! 

I was invited to join some friends and despite arriving at 4pm, we didn't get seated until quarter to 7. (disclaimer: the party # changed twice)

It was very lively and a fun atmosphere in the meantime! 

I had the fish tacos, guac and chips, rice and beans and eggplant empanadas. All were delicious.

I'm not a fan of eggplant, but would order again! The empanadas had an italian flavor and the perfect crisp shell.

The fish tacos were off the chain! doubled on the corn tortilla was appreciated! 

Margaritas were basic, but flavorful.

Amazing service despite an overcrowded night.

I was so excited to finally try Botica. A side-street restaurant on the cusp of Midtown was the perfect place for brunch with my family. I even came for the first time earlier this week for their happy hour for a work event. Both times have been great. The location is amazing right across the street from the hive. The parking is very convenient with an attached parking deck where you can validate your parking when you walk into the restaurant. We were sat very quickly and the food was brought out even quicker. The TVs outside were all playing Sunday afternoon football which was great no matter what team you're going for. We ordered the chicken nachos, Que padre, chicken and waffles, and an omelette. Everything was a 10 out of 10! I would definitely be returning for another happy hour or even for when the game is on.

I'm not sure what this place is trying to be because it's like a mix between trendy Mexican food and sports bar. It was SO loud inside, I would not have stayed. Botica's redeeming quality is definitely the outdoor seating! Our waiter was friendly and helpful when we mentioned that we needed to leave by a certain time. 
The food was okay - the appetizers were not well plated for sharing. I got the Chicken Enchiladas with Verde and while the enchiladas were good, I was very disappointed by the rice. It looked like it would've been flavorful, but it was bland and even slightly weird tasting. Further, I feel like the meal should've come with both rice and beans. While I didn't have a bad experience, I'd definitely select my hole-in-the-wall, more authentic Mexican food before coming here.

I'll start by saying i love coming here. It's such a cool spot to hang out at the bar or bring friends. I just stopped in for happy hour but was extremely pleased with my selections. I had the raw oysters and hot wings with avocado ranch to eat and a few spicy pineapple margaritas to wash it down. 10 out of 10.

photos.caption: Hot wings with avocado ranch and spicy pineapple margarita.

comment.text:
A sports bar feel serving mexican cuisine in the Buckhead Atlanta area. They have a garage attached and will validate up to 3 hours of parking. Their menu items are a bit pricey compared to other great mexican places, and 20% gratuity is added to every bill...no matter the size of the party. 

I was a bit disappointed by how our large party was handled. The ordering process was chaotic and unorganized, and some orders came out incorrect. Giving the benefit of the doubt, maybe it was just an off night.

Aside for that, I enjoyed my meal. My entree and soft drink came out to be $37, which is a little expensive in my opinion, but they gave a good birthday experience with free dessert & birthday shots!! 

Shrimp Nachos: 8.5/10 
I really enjoyed this entree. It was a huge portion filled with toppings and flavors. I didn't feel skimped on anything & had plenty to take home after.

I found this spot after getting my hair cut at the salon suites inside the building. Parking is free. The Nachos are great. The best ambiance on Saturday/Sunday are the large TVs for games. If the weather is nice opt for outside patio with friends. We came back and sat at the bar and the bartender was friendly and engaging. They even poured me a sample or something he was making for another customer. I like that kind of bartender.

I've been here once before but wanted to try the brunch this time. I'm glad I did because it was worth it. 

Parking is in a garage behind the restaurant but it can fill up fast. When you go inside they had an iPad where you put in your tag# and your parking is validated. 

The menu didn't have alot of options which is good because it helps me narrow down what I want. I went with the Botica Omelette which was good but seems as though it was missing something. The cocktails were good and strong. 

Definitely a place you need to visit.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for the glowing review!

comment.text:
Update: I came back a month after coming here for the first time because I was dying to come back and try something new, and I'm so glad I did!! I went on a Wednesday so of course I had to try their paella (note: you can only order the paella on Wednesday after 3pm, and it is $30), and it was one of the best I've ever had, which was surprising since I've had plenty homemade ones! There were mussels, shrimp, clam, other delicious seafood, and even little bites of well-seasoned chicken! 

Also, since it is Women's History Month our server gave my friend and I complimentary champagne and shots. And it goes without saying that everyone from the host to the servers were as kind and attentive as ever. This has easily become one of my favorite restaurants I have been to.

photos.caption: Paella! Absolutely amazing!! Can order Wednesday after 3pm

owner_replies.comment: We love that you had such a delicious experience! We hope to see you back again soon.

comment.text: Still a wonderful spot! After searching all over Atlanta, for a spot to host 18 people, this place did not charge for a large party or hold me up with unnecessary catering details. The reservation was easy to confirm and everyone was happy. Our server(s) were wonderful, and this location made my birthday celebration spectacular. Keep up the good work!

Update review: came back after a while but this time for brunch! The waitress ( blanking on name she was training a new person) was soo nice and helpful with telling us her favorites! I personally love chilaquiles so i went for the chilaquiles! i got a side of the cheesey grits with it and not only was it absolutely yummy but also so filling! 

This place is beautiful and so vibey! 1. They validate parking!! Amazing 2. They have so many cool spots indoors but also a great patio that can be covered if it rains which it did and they have heaters as well as tvs to watch sports games! 

Weird unwarranted Recommendation: It would be so epic if yall  hosted bachelor viewing parties mondays so everyone in atl could watch the tragedy together lol it would get a lot of people in lol

photos.caption: Happy hour M-F 4-6 with $5 sangria and tapas deals

owner_replies.comment: Welcome back! We're extremely excited to read about your positive experience. We hope to see you back again soon.

comment.text: Went to Botica with some friends last night, it was ok, nothing amazing or out of the ordinary. I got a pineapple mojito mocktail and it was way too sweet! Tasted like pineapple syrup. The chips and salsa was great, I got the steak quesadillas which was actually pretty good but the rice was not well seasoned at all. The ambience is chic and lovely, I like the outdoor patio. Service was ok even though the place wasn't packed, we had to ask for water, I feel like that should be standard. They add a 20% gratuity to your check automatically so look out for that.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Zina, would you mind sending an email to info@eatbotica.net about your experience as well? We would love for you to give our restaurant another opportunity.

comment.text:
I ABSOLUTELY loved my experience at Botica. I came here on a Sunday for my birthday celebration. We had 15 ppl at the table and the service was stellar. Jennifer was our server and she was very attentive and friendly. 
We ordered the mimosas (so delicious, go for the mango/pineapple), and a slew of appetizers and meals. I enjoyed the queso, salsa and guacamole (and I'm picky about my guac). All of our food came out perfectly with no mistakes, the brought out bday shots to celebrate, and bread pudding with a candle. 
Everyone truly enjoyed their food (I got the omelette and it was yummy). I hope they expand their vegetarian options 

Parking is in deck and you just need to have your license plate to get a virtual validation inside the restaurant. 

I'll be back.

Great food, drinks and vibe.  Their decor is on point  Came with some friends and we had a great time. All their drinks were decent.  Their watermelon margarita was my favorite . I also couldn't get enough of their Burrata.

How on earth does this place have 4 stars?? This is a two star place and thats being a bit too nice. 

Spanish and Mexican is not a usual fusion and there's a huge reason. 

Ok so let's start with ambiance. Logo and first look at the place, it has a Mexican restaurant vibe and that's why we chose it. I'm all about my hispanic vibes all day everyday and even happier when some reggaeton is playing. 
 
The style of the restaurant from seating to drapes doesn't match at all. Extremely awkward and then you have huge tv's in your face. 

I look at the menu to find out they have "Spanish" food. I ordered the gambas alajillo, a meat taco, and churros. 

The gambas were ridiculously disgusting, not fresh and not deveined. The shrimp came with the head on and I thought I would need to rip them off but no, those were just decorative. They were old re used shrimp heads that were severely discolored that's just how old they were. How deplorable!! The sauce it came in was pretty good but not traditional and I didn't taste much if garlic there. Then they had these two slices of bread pre dipped inside for you all sogged up. Zero class. There was NOTHING Spanish about this and I am insulted. Take the word Spanish out of this place because this is NOT they way we do it. 

The taco was just ok/edible and nothing I would ever come back for. 

The "churros", I thought for sure this part would be the saving grace. I couldn't believe it, NOT churros. It's fried dough shaped to appear like them but no way. And the chocolate, nasty. 

Been in ATL for years and this is the worst restaurant I've ever been too. Worse than the one with the roaches crawling everywhere that got more stars since the food was delicious. Guess I'm pretty over worked about this but don't put certain cultures of food on the menu when you don't know how to cook it!!

photos.caption: Old re used shrimps head. Nasty!!
Shrimp was not fresh or de veined! Eater be ware!

comment.text:
This is such a cute and colorful place; walking in instantly puts you in an upbeat mood. I went on a Saturday afternoon and the server gave us both a brunch menu and a regular menu. Everything sounded so good so it took some time to choose and some of us ordered multiple dishes so we could share. For drinks, I started with a CoCo. This is such a refreshing drink thanks to the cucumber/coconut combination. It's reminiscent of a day on the beach. With that side, it's a little light on the alcohol. It takes more like a really refreshing mocktail. Still a good drink but I ended up switching to a Jack and Ginger Beer. Now, for food:

Halibut Ceviche: This may be one of the best ceviches I've ever had. The halibut tastes fresh, it had great texture (firm but not dry) and I lived the amount of acidity this ceviche had. It may be too much for some but if you like a lot of acid, you'll love this.

Lamb Birria taco: The flavor wasn't bad but the tortilla was soggy and started to fall apart before I could even pick it up. Also, it could use another scoop or two of lamb. It's not much meat on the taco. Also, I thought birria tacos were supposed to be dunked. This was my first time but I think I've always seen them dunked. I only received a tiny shot of jus with this taco. 

Chicken shawarma: Sooo good! It reminded me of the chicken shawarma wraps I used to get from a place back home. Really great flavor and the chicken was pretty juicy. The freshness of the tomatoes really helps to balance out the richness of the tahini.
Came in on a whim!! Wanted a good margarita and taco. Margarita was good but the fish taco was average.

This place is awesome! Service is always cheerful, joyous, and welcoming ! I went at night so the patio was perfect on such a warm and steamy night! 

There is so much to eat on this menu where do I start? 

The mussels hands down are a must try! The menu is diverse so order everything you want to try!

I'll start by saying amazing our server ChiChi was amazing. He was really attentive and fun. We had an all female cousins night out and it was an amazing time. We were seated in the heated/covered patio which was nice on a cool rainy night. The music wasn't too loud and the vibe was cool. 

For the drinks: We had a pineapple mojito (I was never a fan of mojitos but would drink this), frozen pineapple margarita (amazing), and a Casamigo margarita with a splash of ginger beer (nice and strong how I like it). 
 
For the food: There were lots of tacos had (chicken shawarma, lamb birria, carne asada, grilled shrimp) and a chicken quesadilla. There were no complaints at all. 

I would most definitely return and ask for ChiChi!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for taking the time to write this glowing review! We're very grateful for you!

comment.text: Came here with the wifey on a Sunday. Had the Spanish coffee, Mimosa flight, shrimp and grits, Chilaquiles Fiesta and a great times. Great food and the bartenders were awesome. Out bartender was Lady George who made sure our food and drinks were on point. We ate good and drank good. We were there for over 2  hours and enjoyed ever second. My new spot with good ppl. We were in the mood for something different for breakfast/ brunch and they didn't disappoint.

You can see the ambiance of this restaurant from driving down the street, and thats exactly what brought me and a couple friends in on a Sunday afternoon. Indoor and Patio seating options let  you find the setting that suits your liking. With a crowd you can almost expect a lack in service and thats exactly what I experienced. This definitely was unfortunate as a 20% gratuity is automatically included. The food looked and smelled good but was quite bland to look so seasoned. On a positive, the portions were huge and they had a mimosa special...which is everyones brunch language. If I return that's what it'd be for.

3.5 standard bar vibes!

Went here on St. Patrick's Day and it was pretty packed! They were giving out green beads haha and the DJ was popping off. 

They validate parking in the garage for the building! 

Service was aloof but kind. We had to flag our server for multiple things but overall he handled our request (more to come) nicely. I understand it was a super busy night too.

We got the nachos appetizer with steak and it hit the spot!! It was thick/shareable and while on the colder side was heavy with ingredients. 

For the entree we split the seafood paella (which isn't on the menu but when we asked our server about it he mentioned it was an available special). The pictures looked amazing but honestly the taste was a bust :'( the moment we got the dish it was super fishy and didn't smell fresh. There's around 2 pieces of each seafood option too which was disappointing. We told our server about it and how we just couldn't finish, which he was kind enough to comp without question (appreciate it!!). 

All in all probably more fun when you're getting tipsy haha - the food was hit or miss, but the location is a bop.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your feedback! We hope you come back again as we strive to provide only the most delicious food to our guests.

comment.text: The food awesome and the service was outstanding! The noise level was a bit much, making conversations on our table hard, but the food, drinks, and service made up for it. Definitely worth another visit the next time we are in Atlanta!

$270 for brunch and honestly nothing was extremely tasty or memorable.

They're earing three stars because our waitress Tati was friendly, sociable and made us feel welcomed from beginning to end. Also its a peak location for watching cars drive down Peachtree Street if you're into that kinda thing. 

We went with the mimosa flight ($48).  It was served with a carafe of orange juice and a miniature carafe of mango nectar.  Not to be confused with bottomless mimosa, once your bottle if empty its another $48 if you want more.

For appetizers, we had the grilled oysters ($17) and wagu albondigas, which is basically two meatballs ($16).  The oysters were tiny and flavorless.  You couldn't even tell there were oysters on the shell they were so tiny. The meatballs were undercooked and pink on the inside so we pushed those to the side and forgot all about them. Someone came by and cleared our plates so quietly, they were taken off the table before I had a chance to let someone know they were undercooked and able to ask to have them removed from the check.   I did enjoy the marinara sauce and toasted sourdough bread that comes with it.

Next up we tried the shrimp taco and crispy fish taco ($5.50 each).  These were by far the best part of the entire meal. Flavorful and the pepper that accompanied the fish taco was a nice spicy surprise. If I was to return it would be for the tacos. I was very pleased with the amount of shrimp and fish on the tacos.  

The brunch menu just was not appealing so three of us ordered the Steak and Eggs. Weirdly we were charged $24 for one and $25 for the other two.  the eggs were cooked to order and we all commented that the steak was tender but it was the chimichurri sauce on top that complimented the meat the best.  The potatoes were dry and tasteless. Not even dipping them in the hollandaise sauce made them either better. 

One person went with the Rack of Lamb ($36) three tiny lamb chops also with the flavorless potatoes. 

When I visited their website, I saw it stated that a 20% service charge is added to all parties of six or more, so it was a disappointment to receive the check and see the 20% service charge added to our party of four.  I mentioned this to our waitress and she explained that the 20% is added to ALL CHECKS, regardless of party size.  She also showed me the menu where it states that 20% is added to all check. 

If you want a nice patio experience on Peachtree Street, consider this place, but I don't recommend anything other than the shrimp or fish tacos.  

They offer to validate your parking, so give the hostess your tag number when you enter. I didn't really understand how this worked since there is ni ticket pulled when you enter the garage nor a gate when you exit, but as long as my car isn't booted or towed, it doesn't matter how it gets done, just happy not to have to pay for parking on top of the $270 tab of which $41.50 was a force gratuity

Parking is in the garage, and validated at the iPad in the front of the restaurant, which requires your tag number. It's a large restaurant, with a sizable bar and ample seating. I was with a large group when I went, and we were all seated with no issues, and when the checks came at the end, it was smooth sailing and no issues with anyone's bills. 

A few negatives that stuck out: 

The server brought out drinks and placed them in front of people and we all had no idea what drink it was and who ordered it. It became a little annoying after a while because I ordered a mineral water, but kept getting cocktails placed in front of me. 

In terms of food, it was really, really, really mediocre for the price of the dishes. Also the serving was a LOT smaller than I expected. The overall ambience is very loud, almost like a dive bar late in the night kind of energy. People dancing, having fun, open air patio seating, and the DJ (yes there's a DJ) keeping things lively. But the food was so mediocre, and for someone who went there for dinner, that was a big turn off. I personally don't think I'd go again. But if you're into a place that has lots of drinks, a bar, a lot of energy, and don't mind the party atmosphere, give it a shot! Just don't expect anything spectacular in terms of food or portions.

This place is phenomenal! Ann Marie was our server & everything was amazing! It was out first time coming here, on Mother's Day! We had made a reservation for 3pm & only had to wait about 15 minutes just because it was so busy 
 -  but it was SO worth it!!  Ann Marie made us feel so welcomed & at home! The food, the environment, everything was fantastic! Our host/hostess was amazing as well!  Did I mention their food & drinks were amazing? Well they were!  I also got to meet the chef too! I loved that so so much!! 

I highly highly recommend this place & will definitely be coming back !!

Cool vibe and great food! I came here for brunch and had never ever been! This is on a side of town where the hospital is and not a lot of restaurants so I'm surprised it was here to be honest but love that it's next to a breakfast joint and hello! They have a patio. We had some nachos, tacos and a flight of mimosas... wish I would've taken photos because it was amazing!! And our server was LITERALLY the sweetest. We were there for prolly 3 hours! And had the best service. 

I also loved the food. And I'm Latina so I am hella picky- salsa were on point. And they validate your parking in the parking deck, don't forget it!

This place has such a chilled out vibe. I went for a brunch date and the places was at the right capacity, it was perfect. They even had an egg BBQ grill where they cook some of the meat outdoors - power move 
The service was pretty quick and I was able to have a good date because of that.
I had the shrimp taco and it was so simple and BOOM that flavor blast in your mouth 
Definitely recommend this place

This restaurant is ALWAYS a vibe! The staff is attentive & fun. The food is great but the DRINKS!!! Ommgg! I 1000% recommend their frozen margs in all flavors! Everytime I've visited I have tried different tacos which have all been top tier.

photos.caption: Pork Belly Taco, Grilled Shrimp Taco, & A Pineapple Margarita

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for the glowing review! We hope to see you back dining with us soon.

comment.text: First, the place is really cute and there's a parking deck conveniently attached to the restaurant so points for that. Our table shared the Ceviche and an order of Nachos with chicken and WOW. The ceviche was nice and limey and did not have a fishy taste. The nachos were really well flavored and perfect to share. For my main course I got a grilled shrimp taco and carne asada taco with a side of jalape√±o corn & 10/10, they were all good! And to top it off, the table got bread pudding and the churros for dessert. I would definitely say get the Bread Pudding!!! The churros were alright but they fell a tad dry but honestly, the rest of the meal was so delicious that it didn't bother me. The service was good, nothing above and beyond but we were checked on regularly so that's all I can really ask for

photos.caption: Grilled Shrimp Taco - flour tortilla Carne Asada Taco - flour tortilla Jalape√±o Corn

owner_replies.comment: Wow! What a great review, thank you!

comment.text:
On the pricy end, but good quality food! I only
Ordered their apps and small plates and was full. 
Meatballs: so tasty, so tender. The sourdough bread was also really good as well. 
Brisket taco: the brisket was very flavorful and tender but I wished there was a dipping sauce of either cheese or salsa verde to go with it. You also pay $5 just for 1 taco. 
Mac & cheese: it wasn't too cheesy but that's ok because sometimes too much cheese can be very overwhelming. 
Rose: not too sweet not to tart. 
Waitress: very polite and attentive. 

Overall, although the price was high I appreciated the quality of this place. I would def return if I'm ever in the area again.

Food Great, Service Great, Ambiance Excellent.
Stop by to Treat Myself to a Little Outside Experience and I was immediately greeted with Joyful and Excited Faces.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you so much for the glowing review!

comment.text:
Sucks to write a bad review for a small business, but here goes...
Disorganized and unprofessional staff
Staff spends more time socializing than working.
Pretty sure staff is HIGH or otherwise wasted.
Food is mediocre for the expensive price (doesn't taste like fresh ingredients)
Sports bar vibe/food for luxury dining cost, not worth the parking!
No management, just not the same place.  
The owner was too busy tyring to get numbers instead of managing the food quality, service, and customer experience.  I should have gone to Taco Bell...smh

Perfecto!!! Not only amazing food, vibrant ambiance, great everything and superb service, but a fun, great dining experience unlike many traditional boring Buckhead "same old" places, with same old faces.

Chef Mimmo is incredible, place is a MUST, staff is excellent, patio is great, nothing but A+!
Love Botica, we had so much fun and will be back soon! Cheers!

Tonight was a little weird like no one acknowledged we we re there sat there for a while no one noticed us finally thank  God Lenny did He took good care of us he made me feel better about my forth experience I had a great time cheers  @botica great customer service even though it started left had a great time drinks and food was great thank you

photos.caption: Frozen margarita and a shot tequila

comment.text: Service is A1! I love this place! The drinks are strong yet beautiful ! The oysters are a must have! The fresh guacamole is a must have! Lamb birria must have! An Atlanta gem for sure!

owner_replies.comment: We're honored, thank you so much!

comment.text:
Tacos were ok, but drinks and queso were good. I do like that you can mix and match tacos. They were pretty good, but I do like my tacos from a whole in the wall places where they taste more authentic.  The atmosphere seemed pretty fun! I'd definitely be returning here. 
There's parking garage right behind it and the validate parking.

I saw this place on tv today and visited because it was National Fish Taco Day. We had a blast. Parking was easy. There is a deck and you walk right in and put your license plate in at the register and parking is free. Our server MiMi was very informative and professional yet friendly. The fish was as light and flavorful as promised. We also tried several dishes from the happy hour menu all were fantastic especially the head on grilled shrimp swimming in garlic butter which included large chunks of garlic. The wagu meatball was flavorful and so was the hummus plate. The place is large with big screen TVs all over and after 7 it's quite lively. I can't wait to return.

owner_replies.comment: We can't wait for you to return as well! Thank you for the 4-stars!

comment.text:
I was greeted upon entrance. I was meeting a group of friends who were already sitting. Once you enter the building, there's a kiosk to enter your license plate number to validate your parking.
 Our waiter Juan was pleasant and answered all questions that we had. He checked. on us throughout the meal. My salmon was delicious. I ordered an extra side of grilled veggies to go along with it though. Everyone else at the table enjoyed their meal as well. It was a nice vibe and I would definitely return.

Came in on a Friday night and luckily there was no wait. Restaurant with nice vibes and a big bar.

Drinks: had the house margs: strong, delicious, $10

Food: started with the chips and queso which our server happily refilled. A little bit on the more expensive side for appetizers. For dinner, I got the lamb birria and fried fish tacos. The lamb birria was too saucy unfortunately - couldn't get a distinct lamb taste. The fried fish taco was one of the best I've had in a long time.

Service: no complaints about the servers but do note that the restaurant adds an automatic 20% tip to all tabs 

Parking: parking garage in the same building, they validate parking up to 3 hours which was great!

photos.caption: Tacos: Lamb Birria (left) and Fried Fish (right)

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback about your experience!

comment.text: I chose this restaurant for a Sunday girls brunch as I heard it was good and they were participating in ATL Cocktail Week. I was happy to find that they validate 3 hours of parking. You can register yourself once you arrive inside the restaurant. It's vibrantly decorated and pretty. I ordered the steak chilaquiles with both sauces. We also had mimosas. I was satisfied with both. There were a few things I didn't care for. The Nespresso martini was the special cocktail. The coffee flavor was overpowering at the end of the drink, we couldn't finish it. The server was helpful when we arrived and made sure to get our order placed and delivered but drifted off. They didn't come to check on us for 45 minutes. I eventually flagged them down for the check which needed to be corrected due to incorrect pricing but was fixed without issue. I was not happy with the 20% auto gratuity for a party of 3. I would suggest going before football starts. The bar area was very sports bar-esque, we even got stopped by an intoxicated patron trying to buy us drinks on our way out.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Melissa, we thank you for your feedback. Would you mind sending your experience to info@eatbotica.net as well?
